Description: Crowd gathers and volunteers who have opted to be arrested by government are garlanded. Procession begins towards Civil Secretariat--however, changes course and turns into a large protest that surges through Mall Road. The crowd chanted Anti-Government, Anti-Police and Anti-Ahmadi slogans--the police intervened at Charing Cross. Thirty-four persons were arrested under section 107/151 of the Code of Criminal Procedure. Crowd dispersed.

Crowd gathers and volunteers who have opted to be arrested by government are garlanded. Procession begins towards Civil Secretariat--however, changes course and turns into a large protest that surges through Mall Road. The crowd chanted Anti-Government, Anti-Police and Anti-Ahmadi slogans--the police intervened at Charing Cross. Thirty-four persons were arrested under section 107/151 of the Code of Criminal Procedure. Crowd dispersed.
Maulana Ahmad Ali organizes huge procession outside Delhi gate- crowd turned violent. Bricks thrown at police cars. Maulana Ahmad Ali and thirty two others arrested.
Another procession that was determined upon marching into the Government House, was stopped by the police. Twenty nine arrested.
Another procession set out in late afternoon, was stopped near Charing Cross, many men gave themselves up for arrest.

Procession sets out (numbered 10,000) in the evening. The crowd was hostile and rowdy, and was stopped at Charing Cross in the presence of the Commissioner, the Home Secretary, the Inspector- General of Police, the D. I. G. Police and the S. S. P.  The Maulana was arrested, and the crowd attacked the police with tins, bats, bottles etc. Eleven police officers were injured and the crowd had to be lathi-charged. Maulana was moved to jail and forty-one persons were arrested.

Maulana was moved to jail and forty-one persons were arrested.

At the Civil Lines Police Station, letter drafted to GOC 10th Armored Division, Lahore for stand-by aid. Alongside, an order was issued, prohibiting an assembly of five or more persons from collecting within the Corporation limits of the City of Lahore ‚Äòexcluding the area surrounded by the Circular Road‚Äô.
Military fills in, starts patrolling areas.

31 people arrested for assembling, defying the order passed on the prev. Day Procession coming from Nila Gumbat to Mall Rd was dispersed near Tollington Market by Lathi charge, ordered by M.A.K Chaudhry, Assistant Superintendent of Police.

31 people arrested for assembling, defying the order passed on the prev. Day Procession coming from Nila Gumbat to Mall Rd was dispersed near Tollington Market by Lathi charge, ordered by M.A.K Chaudhry, Assistant Superintendent of Police.

Mob of about a hundred stoned and seriously injured police led by Inspector Agha Sultan Ahmad, during their procession from McLeod Road towards the Charing Cross via Montgomery Road. Police fired three rounds. No casualties.

31 people arrested for assembling, defying the order passed on the prev. Day Procession coming from Nila Gumbat to Mall Rd was dispersed near Tollington Market by Lathi charge, ordered by M.A.K Chaudhry, Assistant Superintendent of Police.
Order of arrest passed for Maulana Abdus Sattar Niazi, for his highly inflammatory speech given at Wazir Khan Mosque. Arrest not carried out because mosque surrounded by agitators and protestors.

Crowd of protestors from Sarghoda dispersed by police.  Crowd of 110 Ahrar volunteers start from Brandreth Road and reach Chowk Dalgran where they were tear gassed, lathi charged, yet still refused to disperse. Eventually had to be put into trucks and taken away.

Rumors of police-committed blasphemy spread by using a few torn pages of the Holy Quran. Maulvi Mohammad Yusuf gives inciting speech to crowd, hatred for the police seeps through the streets of Lahore.  Opposing witness statements produced by the Ahrar and Majlis-e-Amal (Muhammad Nazir witness No. 32, Muhammad Hanif witness No. 33, Sheikh Muhammad Rafiq witness No. 34 and Siraj Din witness No. 37) however, state that the events of a policeman tearing up the Quran had indeed happened.  (Sources used: Munir Report and Written Statements of Officers at Lahore, LUMS Archive)
Sayyad Firdaus Shah, Deputy Superintendent of Police killed by protestors using knives and sticks.

Curfew imposed at night, police take rounds of city. Firing on crowds at Bhati Gate, Naulakha Bazaar, Circular Road, McLeod Road, Nisbet Road, GawalMandi, Mochi Gate. Whole city in state of absolute chaos.

Manzur Ahmad, an Ahmady teacher, stabbed and murdered. More murders, looting and arson follow. Shops and properties belonging to Ahmadys and the government set ablaze. Police vehicles set on fire, two post offices burnt. Work came to a halt.

Islamia College students march to Dyal Singh College and protest with students from there. From there they marched to University Hall and then to Government College. Police interaction was avoided.  Curfew imposed from 3.30 pm to 6am, and meeting of any more than five persons prohibited.

processions start pouring into the mosque. Work at all government offices suspended
The Kotwali was besieged by angry mobs, tear gas was fired from rooftops.
Muhammad Shafi Burmawala, an Ahmady, killed in Moghalpura
Jamil Ahmad, an Ahmady college student, murdered inside Bhati Gate.
On Flemming Road,  Mirza Karim Beg, an Ahmady, was murdered and his body thrown atop a burning pyre of furniture

Pak Rays, Shafa Medical, Orsuco, Musa and Sons’ shop, the Rajput Cycle Works, the godowns of Malik Muhammad Tufail and Malik Barkat Ali, the house of Malik Abdur Rahman on Mason Road, five Ahmadi houses on Mozang and Temple Roads, including that of Sheikh Nur Ahmad, Advocate.
